column4: On my sub 1Ghz 512MB ram machine I installed ubuntu server and then added a lightweight WM, abiword instead of openoffice etc etc. a nice read is here
What WM?
ion3.
Alright, thank you
but Open box is great as well. Window Maker is good, ice-wm as well. thunar or pcmanfm as a filemanager.
as long as you stay away from the heavy weights you're good to go (gnome, kde, xfce is getting there)
how bad is xfce on a low spec computer?
it's not bad. but it used to be much better.
OK
I'm doing this over VNC, will I run into problems changing over using the instructions at http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/purexfce ?
i doubt you will run into problems. if you do you can re-install ubuntu-desktop and you should be alright.
OK. I just don't have a monitor or keyboard around so it would be something of a pain if it was to be problematic
Not quite true, I'd just have too look for them
depends on how you have set up vnc
What should I be concerned about specifically?
if you use ~/.vnc/xstartup script it's the same. if you use gnome's VINO then you probably can run into login probs.
Nuts, I'm using VINO I think. I'll change that
if you have an ssh server active on the remote machine then you at least have a command line backup to restore some settings.
I don't... that could have been an unpleasant oversight.
need to sleep. good luck with it all.
Thank you very much
